Reviews.Title: “4 Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: James E Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small but clean and tidy - not too cluttered. I can imagine the tall narrow stairs being a problem for elderley visitors, but this didn't bother us. The only real dissapointment was that there was no tv in the room- in the hotels defence TV isn't listed as a room facility, but this was an oversight from my part as the majority of hotels now have TVs as basic (at least in the UK!) Staff are great, very friendly and allow you to leave luggage in the hotel after check-out if you have a late flight, so you are able to soak a few more hours of Amsterdam up without carrying luggage around! Overall, very pleased, lovely area and easily accessible, would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: STEPHEN K Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay here from Sunday 8th April-Thursday 12th April. Close to beautiful and reasonable restaurants and bars. Lovely breakfast. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and basic”
Reviews.Author: Carol K
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in a very convenient location, The staff are friendly. The rooms do not have a TV or tea and coffee making facilities. The mattresses are thin but the sheets are clean underneath the blanket. Breakfast was bread, 1 ham slice, 1 cheese slice, jam, tea or coffee. We had almost finished when a boiled egg arrived. I was still hungry afterwards and juice would have been a welcome addition. All in all it seemed a little expensive for what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Van Onna”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was excellent with only a 5 minute walk to the Anne Frank house and trips on the canal boats, as well as being a leisurely 15 minute walk from the train station and central Amsterdam. The service was also good with the staff being very friendly and welcoming. However I would not choose to stay there again as we found that the hotel itself was noisy at night, and the breakfast that was included was terrible, making it not particularly good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “For short-trips middel-rated / accepable”
Reviews.Author: Freddy B Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: At first, very good located. 5 Min to Anne-Frank-House and many bars, Restaurants and supermarkets by feet.. 10 Mins to the city.. 25 Min to central-station. Nearly perfect. The Hotel is "small" like nearly all houses in Amstaerdam. snuggish. Our Room "70" was very comfortable (one of two rooms in the attic). Facilities were not very modern, but thereÂ´s no need in Amsterdam, if you like the "city-flair". There were two easy chairs, table and the double bed. This is the "good-part". the big BUT: breakfast for two persons: cup of jam, little bit butter, coffee (5x filtered water - black tea is darker), 2 slices cheese and (not looking good) ham.. some other guests showed some pics of their rooms - smaller thain ours, and not so comfortable, without any storage possibillity (all rooms).. Conclusion. for a short stay - ok. booking better without breakfast (there are many good cafes around the hotel). Booking only if one of the rooms in the attic are availible. The carrier of the hotel talks english very well.

Reviews.Title: “Basic.”
Reviews.Author: Glenn M
Reviews.Content: Basic in every way. Basic customer service. Basic room. Basic breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “simple, sweet, and worth the stay”
Reviews.Author: absolutelyworth t Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: went for a weekend there. The room is simple but pretty clean, breakfast is basic, people there were very nice and helpful. The hotel is located in probably one of the best districts to discover Amsterdam, very central but not too touristy, the street is absolutely lovely and picturesque. A bike rental is in the same street. Two vegetarian/vegan restaurants very close, many bars, restaurants etc. and close to the shopping malls and the main street on which the regular shops you find in every major city are located... oh, and did I mention coffee shops on every second corner? :-) I can recommend that hotel for everybody who wants to discover Amsterdam and is ok with a simple but sweet hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: James A Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I had a lovely weekend get away here and loved every moment of it the staff were very helpful the room was clean and very comfortable and having a great breakfast included was a big bonus

Reviews.Title: “cheap, great location and easy to book”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I needed a last minute room last weekend and after numerous searches online and a few phone calls. Hotel Van Onna was by far the cheapest and easiest to book. The wireless internet was great. The dude at the frontdesk was nice and helpful - the only thing I'd ask is for a heads up that there is no elevator for taking your luggage to your room.

Reviews.Title: “What a Fabby Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LadyEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: Me and my daughter stayed there when we went for a weekend break in Amsterdam. The hotel is small but full of character and spotlessly clean. So near all the attractions for example Anne Frank's house etc. and a walk to Dam Square was 15 mins max. I recommend this hotel for people who are staying in Amsterdam for a short period of time and who intend to spend the day out of the hotel doing things. A huge thank you to all the staff who made our stay so enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Very happy reviewer”
Reviews.Author: Ro C Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for what we were looking for, cheap and cheerful. We were very close to all amenities and when we requested a particular room, we were supplied with it and no one bothered us so we were incredibly happy. The place was clean and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Value and location.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The staff was helpful and friendly, breakfast was included. In suite washroom. Quiet location. The room was small, but on a budget just over the price of the hostels (which were booked out for the weekend) offered privacy. The rooms are in an old, renovated building in walking distance to the center. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: diana k
Reviews.Content: small & basic rooms. location is perfect. staff is helpfull, nice breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, no surprises”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth S
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Amsterdam jet-lagged in the morning. We went to the hotel hoping to at least be able to drop off our bags. We were delighted when they offered to us check in early at 9:30 and then offered us breakfast too. We were refreshed after a little food and a short nap. The room was small (to be expected in Amsterdam) and spartan. But the bed was comfortable and the room was quiet. No other room amenities. But we don't travel to watch tv and we have our own cellphones, so why pay for those things? Breakfast was simple, but filling. In the dining room you will find a collection of guide books. We loved, loved the location in the Jordaan neighborhood! As soon leaving the hotel, it was easy to find a nice restaurant or pub or interesting shop that locals visited as well as tourists. It was a treat to walk the nearby streets and see how people live in this cool city. It's around a 20 min walk to train station. There were some random photos of Anthony Perkins decorating the walls. Wish I could have figured out the connection.

Reviews.Title: “lovely attic room”
Reviews.Author: sonia_liguria
Reviews.Content: Hotel Van Onna is in a peaceful area on a beautiful canal, close to the city centre but not in the touristic, noisy places. We stayed 3 nights, the first in the big attic room, then in a smaller attic room, both on the top floor. (i booked in advance). Each attic room is full of windows. The room is perfect if you don't mind a lot of steps! The bathroom is basic (except the view!) but clean. The bed linen was so thin that was ripped in the night! It was funny and we had a new one the day after. Breakfast is simple but very good.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: HelmutSchnitzel
Reviews.Content: I've been to Amsterdam a few times and have gotten accustom to paying 200 to 300 euro's for a decent centrally located room usually without a direct canal view. Hotel Van Onna was a fraction of the price and we had the most spectacular view of a canal you can imagine. We were there on a beautiful spring day and it was so nice sitting in bed watching the city float by that we had a hard time actually leaving the room. Yes, the hotel looks like an old sailors quarters and probably hasn't been updated much since that time period but the beds are comfortable, the rooms are clean, the breakfast is great, the location is fantastic, and the view is worth substantially more than what they are charging. I'm sure I'll be back in Amsterdam and I'm sure this is the first place I'll try and find a room.

Reviews.Title: “Aloof, hidden and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: Ralph T
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very basic (rooms appear institutional, not well appointed) and not particularly good value for money spent. There are lots of steps to climb.The management charges an additional 5% if you use your credit card. The breakfast is good and they provide enough to eat. The location is excellent being close to 2 tram lines, one at either end of the street. HARD TO FIND. When we first arrived we walked down many streets from the tram station and no one in the area could tell us where Bloemgracht street was. Here is an easy way to find the place. Stand in front of the main entrance of the Anne Frank house and look across the canal. The street you see is Bloemgracht (notice the right side and left side of this street). Cross the canal at the nearest bridge and walk to this same street that you saw from the Anne Frank house.Walk down the right side (with the canal on your left) for about 5 minutes... Van Onna Hotel is on the right.

Reviews.Title: “excellent overall, especially for the price.”
Reviews.Author: jim w
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the van Onna for two nights and was very pleased. It is located on a pretty canal in a nice and quiet quarter. My room was very very small, but big enough for what I needed to do, which was to sleep. (If you have a lot of luggage this is not the hotel for you,) It was quiet at night. The room was very clean. The building appears to have been rebuilt recently and the quality of construction is very good. No elevator. I found the staff friendly and helpful. There was plenty of food at breakfast. Egg, coffee, bread, a little ham, a little cheese, but no fruit, no yogurt, no juice. I would stay here again without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “don't expect too much”
Reviews.Author: Christina1960
Reviews.Content: Hotel faces on to a canal lovely location - my husband and I were in the adjoining building (did ask for a canal view didnt get one) got no view room was like an army barracks room - two twin beds with rough blankets over them bathroom had a mop to scoop water back into shower cubical (if your taller than 5ft 2 you may find this claustrophobic) couldn't sit on toilet has not enough room between wall and toilet , Not a cheap hotel compared to other city hotels was more like a hostel also a charge of 5% for debit or credit card payments. City was lovely as was the weather. wouldn't recommend this hotel to friends Hotel is near the Anne Frank musuem

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Thais_Gerk
Reviews.Content: Nice and comfortable place, nice view from the room I stayed. Nice breakfast too. Besides a really rude gentleman on the staff, I would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to write home about”
Reviews.Author: karthikprasannan
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed in Van Onna during the first week of sept 2011. First of all the place was difficult to find, the taxi driver had no clue and we had to actually use our gps to find the location and then again ask an elderly couple who gladly took us there...Van Onna is more like a hostel i would say with a pretty jammed room. We had a room in the 3rd floor and guess what!!! No elevators....they had a basic breakfast to offer which was included in the price.the staff were friendly and helpful and they have free wifi. Btw they charge an extra 5% on credit cards !!!! The place is very close to most of the attractions in Dubai and very close to Anne Frank House. But at around 100 euros per night i dont know how worthy it is.

Reviews.Title: “cosy”
Reviews.Author: lonestar28
Reviews.Content: The place was nice, by the canal, eventhough the rooms are small and bathroom seemed to ask for some maintenance (shower). There is no lift :/ simple basic rooms, no extras. Wifi doesnt work in the rooms but only in the stairs. Breakfast could be better. They ask cash payments otherwise 5% surcharge.. Location is quiet but at the same time not so central. Ask for a room with a canal view - costs the same.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: HeatherUK
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a brilliant price and has an amazing location. Very basic rooms, but clean and just what you need. You also get free wifi and free breakfast which is a hard boiled egg, 2 white & 2 brown slices of bread, ham, cheese, toast, jam and for some reason chocolate sprinkles. We warned that there are lots of steps and no elevator. The only downside was that the walls are very thin and I could hear people walking up and down the steps all night. Loved this hotel and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: mb_dan
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the neighborhood and the feel of staying here. Loved the sound of the church bells, the bikes as they ring their bells, and the general feel of this area. The folks at the hotel are very friendly and helpful. The rooms are quaint - we had a strange shower would be my only complaint. It came with a mop to get rid of the water on the floor since there wasn't a shower curtain. I actually loved the winding stairs, but if you have a lot of luggage, you might want to request something lower. I wanted to be up at the top and it was lovely. I would recommend staying here on a visit to Amsterdam. I would definitely stay again if (when?) I get back to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute DREAM! LOVE this hotel & the AMAZING staff!”
Reviews.Author: Crystal1210
Reviews.Content: First off, I have stayed at Hotel Van Onna several times over the past few years. Before, I would stay in hostels and other cheap lodgings but always found the prices too steep and the quarters stifiling. Hotel Van Onna however, was a breath of fresh air! The rooms are large and spacious and modestly decorated. The location is fantastic, located on a quiet street close to the main attractions and within walking distance to everything. The breakfast is delicious: Sandwiches, toast with jam and jimmies, eggs, coffee and tea. If you're traveling on a budget but want your own space and privacy, definitely try Hotel Van Onna. You may not find a 50" flat screen TV but you'll definitely find amazing service (the staff remembers me every time I book and we sometimes keep in touch even when I'm not traveling...) and great accomodatoins! Five Stars.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Ideal budget Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NdrSwindon
Reviews.Content: Good cheap hotel. Location is in quiet area, approx 10 minutes from Dam Square. Room was simple and clean, nice view of the canal. Breakfast done the job and was good set up for the day. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Clean Comfortable Affordable Hotel in Prime Location”
Reviews.Author: Evelyn2109
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at the Hotel Van Onna in 2007 and loved its location in Bloemgracht, which is on a pretty quiet canal in the middle of the lovely Jordaan residential area but is close to the Westmarkt tram stop and is about 20 minutes walk from Centraal Station. So on the 18rh of May 2011, when I was going to London on KLM via Amsterdam (and then on to Prague), I wrote to Hotel Van Onna to see if they had a room available for my time frame. The room, while simple, was quite cozy and very clean. The staff is very hospitable and helpful and I was very happy with the service provided. The breakfast was good and served at one's table, and included in the very reasonable room price. I love Amsterdam with its canals and mansions, museums, nearby fishing villages, and quaint towns, and plan to return and will definitely stay at the Hotel van Onna.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Hikingirl
Reviews.Content: It is situated in the Jordaan, a pleasant and quiet district, in the centre of Amsterdam. The building overlooks the Bloemgracht. The decoration is made of very beautiful black and white pictures of Amsterdam. The rooms are basic but practical and clean. The bathroom could be improved by a shower door or curtain to avoid flood. The hotel is non smoking, a real asset. The staff is friendly and helpful. The breakfast is good and is included in the room price. It is a very good value hotel. The only disadvantage : cash payment only. For a budget hotel, it is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money in a central location and most typical area of Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: Millionthtraveller
Reviews.Content: We had a double room that was newly refurbished and very clean. Our stay was very pleasant a casual walk from the most scenic areas and key venues we wanted to go to. The breakfast was included and uniquely in my travellers experience served to the table - the coffee which I am hard to get pleased by was of excellent quality and the breakfast itself generous. It would be improved by adding orange juice. Still everyone at the hotel was helpful and gave us good advice on where to go in Amsterdam. The hotel is also close to a church that has lovely bells that is if you enjoy those at 7 am but Amsterdam is not a destination for a quiet stay....

Reviews.Title: “Cozy in the Jordaan”
Reviews.Author: Bethalto
Reviews.Content: We expected a basic, affordable room in a great neighborhood, and we were not disappointed. The location was outstanding, on the Bloemgracht, which is quiet all the time in wild and crazy Amsterdam, but is close to the Westmarkt tram stop and in the middle of the beautiful Jordaan. The room, while simple, was quite cozy and the size was fine. I admit I was a little worried about the cot like beds and the wet room bath going in, but my fears proved groundless. The beds were surprisingly comfy and I really came to like the open shower room, just mop up a little with the towel. The staff was friendly at all times and quite professional in their approach to inn keeping. The breakfasts are served at your table in their lovely breakfast room and consist of a boiled egg (treat), ham/cheese, bread/butter/jam, chocolate sprinkles, coffee/tea. Delicious!! Free WiFi was great! Stairs, but easily managed. Amsterdam is an exciting city with fabulous sights and we loved excursions to Haarlem, Delft, and the Waterland towns. Great restaurants in the Jordaan include Cafe de Prins, Soan Thai, and Cafe de Rigeur. Stay at the Van Onna if you value a central location and great neighborhood over frills and want an affordable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “The best vaue for money if on a budget”
Reviews.Author: randstad
Reviews.Content: If you are on a tight budget and still want to stay very central and have a normal room with a bathroom, then this is probably one of the best hotels in Amsterdam. Located in Jordaan area, a truly Amsterdam canal house with a neat and well maintained rooms, Hotel van Onna is a very good value for money. My room was basic but very clean and comfortable. The bathroom was simple but modern, wifi is included in price and faster than in many expensive hotels. I was on the second floor with a view to the courtyard and the room was very quiet. All staff people including the owner were very helpful and friendly. So, totally recommended..

Reviews.Title: “Great location !”
Reviews.Author: PriAssahida
Reviews.Content: The neighbourhood is wonderful, quiet and near of every spot to visit. The staff are friendly and the breakfast is good. The only thing is that the room is small and in the shower ther is no box but the cost benefit worth the visit.

Reviews.Title: “good location and cheap, but dirty and not confortable”
Reviews.Author: montinaviganti
Reviews.Content: The location is very good in nice district (Jordaan), staff is friendly and helpful. Free wireless and walking distance (15 minutes) from central station. Fare is cheap, as compared to the Amsterdam standard (room with private facilities for 45 euro). Breakfast was ok. However, the room was very dirty, especially the floor. I've found hair on the washbasin and there is no curtain in the shower, is it so expensive to buy one? They also gave me just one bath towel. Bed is not confortable, too short, and room noisy (from outside). To sum up, a cheap and central option, but I would not recommend to stay there for more than one night.

Reviews.Title: “I'd go back”
Reviews.Author: WorkToTravel_1111
Reviews.Content: Great location....near lots of transportation connections(streetcar, Metro, canal stop)....but we found we walked most places. Great breakfast and very fast service. A no-nonsense place that fits the bill for price and convenience. Rooms very very small. No tub in bathroom. Stairs almost impossible to get your suitcases up. Front of hotel extremely noisey...quiet street....but if anyone or the birds out front made any noise....you hear it all. But it was so much fun looking out at the canal and watching the action including the noisey birds. For it's uniqueness, the price, and location---we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and comfortable - right on the canals.”
Reviews.Author: jontheron
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Van Onna hotel for two nights in July, as part of a honeymoon trip. I agree with the other posts that describe the hotel as sparse, but comfortable with a nice and helpful staff. The location was great for us, being on the Bloemgracht canal and a nice walk to many of the musems, and sights we wanted to visit. It was really quiet, too - one of the two nights we stayed was the one where Holland beat Uganda for a place in the World Cup finals - as we walked home from bar we watched the game, the city exploded after the game with honking, fireworks and a whole lot of Dutch hooting and hollering. At the hotel, though, all was quiet and we were not disturbed by the noise at all.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and quiet neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: andrew_cam
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Amsterdam and this is where I'll be staying for my next trip. Great location in the Jordaan. Quiet non-commercial street on a canal but close to everything. Friendly and accommodating staff. Reasonable price that includes breakfast brunch. Room are spartan so don't expect a queen size bed with a thick mattress but still comfortable enough for 5 nights. Stairs are typical for most older buildings in Amsterdam. Very steep and narrow. Ask for a ground floor room if you don't want to deal with them. All in all a great place to stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “What you see is what you get”
Reviews.Author: Dees1970
Reviews.Content: The pictures and descriptions give a good image of what you can expect. No luxery, but a simple room with a simple bathroom. The staff is very friendly. Breakfast is ok. The spot is one of the best of Amsterdam. Not noisy. Only disadvantage is that the beds are old and rather firm. If you are 30 years old or younger, it is fine. If you stay one night, it is acceptable. If you can put two matrasses on each other, it is ok, but if your body is a little older, it is tough to sleep well.

Reviews.Title: “Good Prices, Excellent Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Haliku
Reviews.Content: If you want 5 Star then do not stay here. If you want value for your money and a quiet hotel away from the Red Light district then this is a great choice. The staff is friendly and very helpful in planning your visit. The location is 5 minutes from the Anne Frank House and other interesting sites. Being Amsterdam there are more restaurants and bars within a few minutes of your door than we could even visit during our short stay. The beds are comfortable, the rooms are small and the bathrooms are basic but we did not go to Amsterdam to stay in the hotel so it met our needs. My brother and I stay here whenever we are in the city and will again in the near future. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel, Very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: mtpdx
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel based on price, location, and previous reviews. It's certainly no frills- two single beds, very basic. The staff, however, were the kindest people we met in all of Amsterdam. Very friendly- serving breakfast to all guests each morning. If it had not been for their warmth and hospitality, I probably would be fine never returning to Amsterdam again. If you decide to bring a car, parking/checking in can be a little hectic. The hotel provided us with parking options, and it was very easy to get back in to downtown. The price of the off-site parking was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “If you're used to a bit of luxury and cheeriness, think twice.”
Reviews.Author: JohanGerard
Reviews.Content: We ended up staying at the Hotel Van Onna because we were booking pretty late and it was June, so there weren't many choices for inexpensive accommodations in the central city. The staff was very nice and courteous, but quite frankly the room was depressing. The bathroom was tiny and really poorly designed (example: the hook for the towel was placed so low that the towel hung on the floor), the furniture dorm-like, the art was cheesy and haunted us when we laid in bed, and the room felt generally dingy. Now granted this is Amsterdam and how much time are you going to spend in your room, but ours was just too dreary and we checked out after only one night (which to their credit, the hosts were gracious about). I don't mind spare, but spare and gloomy combined was a bit too much. The moral of the story is to book early and put out the extra cash so you'll enjoy hanging out in the room after a long day.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel away from the tourist center”
Reviews.Author: nygenco
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in Jordaan, about a ten minute walk from the red light district. Good basic place to stay. Very reasonable rates. Room was bare bones, but clean and functional. Staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was not a buffet and a bit sparse, but OK. No intenert connection on the premises. Closest connection is a cafe several blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Be prepared for a budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: tcusatis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Van Onna for 3 nights in Sep/09. There was an event in Amsterdam during the period of our stay, so it was really hard to find an avaiable room in the city. We booked the van onna knowing that it was a budget hotel, so be prepared for that... - The location is great, in a beautiful and romantic cannal next to Anne Franke House. It was great to walk by Bloemgracht cannal every day! - We reserved a double room, but they gave us twin beds... - Bathroom is exacty what you see in trip advisor photos, no need to explain... - Breakfast was not good, we actually had it only once, and decided to look for a better place next morning. - There is no internet. - There is a really good place to bike rental 2 blocks from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Stay”
Reviews.Author: going_seeing_doing
Reviews.Content: Basic, budget stay. Austere room, but clean. If you cannot climb many flights of stairs, do not consider this hotel. Bring your own shampoo. Breakfast was pleasant. Located in a peaceful, lovely neighborhood. Sometimes a front desk attendant was difficult to find.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: OzML
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Van Onna for 3 nights. Hotel Van Onna is a modest hotel along a canal in Amsterdam. Upon arrival we were greeted by the friendly owner and directed to our room, which was on the top (4th) floor of the main building. The room was beautiful with views in almost all directions, however it was fortunate that we are both fairly athletic as there is no lift and the stairs get steeper as you get higher up. This hotel has no pretension or illusions of granduer, it is a simple place providing clean lodging - our room had private facilities and we found it great value at a total of EUR90 per night (EUR45 per person per night, cash only). The hotel is easy to access from Schiphol by taking the train to Centraal and then changing to tram 13 or 17 to Westrmarkt and then taking a short walk. It is located in a quiet, inner city residential area, and is a short walk to Dam Square. In the area are several bars, restaurants and 'coffee shops'. A simple breakfast is included each day in a dining room, but no other meals are available. Summary - highly recommended for a simple stay in Amsterdam. If less able bodied or not comfortable with stairs, I suggest requesting a room on a low floor when booking. I booked via the hotel's online form and the hotel replied overnight.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little place”
Reviews.Author: LauraSully
Reviews.Content: Only hotel in a decent price range when I booked due to large festival in Amsterdam. Small but clean room with bathroom down the hall. Great location, easy to get to by tram from train station. Very close to Anne Frank Museum, in pleasant quiet neighborhood. Great breakfast included in price. Excellent value for the price. I would stay again any day.

Reviews.Title: “Buget, but good location and service”
Reviews.Author: joevu1
Reviews.Content: The Hotel can Onna is a very basic hotel. I went with my wife recently and got given a twin bed, in a small room with a bathroom. Location: The hotel is on a street with the canal passing by the front, and is quiet. There is a few bars and restaurants nearby within 2-3 minutes walk. Anne Frank museum is at the end of the street (across other side of canal) and can be reached within 5 mins walk. Tram stop that goes to and from Amsterdam Central station is 5 mins walk (near Anne Frank Museum). Accomodation: Basic room, twin bed, bathroom that gets quite wet when having shower (as there's no real catchment basin) so you need to use this broom (like a windows wiper) in the bathroom to clean it up. The mattress, pillow and town is a little uncomfortable (well, it is basic). There is also not TV, or radio, so you will need to find something to keep yourself busy at night. Service: Service is good, and easy, the people who work there are nice also. Breakfast is very simple, choice of coffee or tea, with bread, cheese, ham, jam, chocolate sprinkles, butter, boiled egg. If you don't like this stuff or you're there for more than 2 days, you'll get sick of it. Overall, a nice place, very basic, but clean, good location, close to public transport, quiet area.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget option if you're traveling alone”
Reviews.Author: dctraveller123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel van Onna for one night in March 2008 and was quite pleased with my stay. This is definitely a budget hotel, but it is a clean, pleasant one, which sets it apart from many other budget places to stay. My flight landed in Amsterdam at 7am and I took the train into Amsterdamâ€™s central station. From there is an easy 15 minute walk to the hotel. (One tip: if youâ€™re only going to be in Amsterdam for a night or two and have a lot of luggage, put your bag in a luggage locker at the airport (6 Euro per day) and just take a small bag into Amsterdam. This is what I did and it was great.) The Jordaan district, where the hotel is located, is really lovely with nice shops, pubs, restaurants and is central but quiet. After a leisurely stroll through Jordaan, I got to the hotel around 9am. Luckily my room had already been vacated and I only had to wait about 20 minutes for them to clean it. They gave me the option of dropping my bag in the room and heading out or having a cup of tea while I waited for them to clean. I waited and my room was available within the 20 minutes they had promised. When I got to my room it was basically as I expected based on the reviews I had read on this site. It was a small clean room with a tiny closet, a fairly comfy chair, two small tables and a bed. It is spartan and basic but I didnâ€™t need anything else. The best feature is a clean, private bathroom. (Trust me, you donâ€™t want to share a bathroom in a budget hotel in Amsterdam.) The worst part of the room is that the bed was not very comfortable â€“ it was basically a cot with a mediocre mattress. The breakfast is fine â€“ a few slices of bread, hardboiled egg, slice of cheese and ham and tea or coffee. Service is pleasant and quick. Overall, this hotel is a good deal for a single traveler. I donâ€™t think you could find anything better for 45 Euro a night in such a great neighborhood. They charge 45 Euro per person regardless of how many people share the room (i.e. 90 for a double and 135 for a triple). People looking for a double or triple might be able to do better at some other hotels. For someone traveling alone this was a great budget find and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal in Amsterdam- But Don't Tell”
Reviews.Author: Mr-Beavis
Reviews.Content: Without doubt, the Van Onna is one of the best kept lodging secrets in Amsterdam. My wife and I stayed there during our honeymoon 25 years ago, I've stayed there twice since then, and my son and I are returning this summer, my wife and I likely in the winter. It's clean, quiet, charming, and the folks who work there are wonderful. Mr. Van Onna is a treasure in and of himself. It's true that the rooms are bare-bones, but it's always looked great behind my eyelids and my pocketbook feels wonderful when I leave. The neighborhood (for that's exactly what it is) is safe, welcoming, and conveniently located. The breakfast is simply a delight. I miss it while I'm writing this. When you consider that it's included in the price of the room (as opposed to the 15 euro charged by others), the value is clear. As for convenience of location... Well, it's exceptionally convenient to central Amsterdam, Central Station and all that goes with that area. Otherwise, quite frankly, Amsterdam is such a small and convenient city that if you can't get around easily, the location of the hotel isn't the problem. If you're looking for luxury and someone to be your handservant, this isn't the place. If you're looking for the best budget deal in the city, I'll see you there soon. Try not tell anyone else, though.

Reviews.Title: “File this one under "you get what you pay for".”
Reviews.Author: morganaus
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting much after reading the previous reviews and that's exactly what I got. This seems to be a family-run operation and they're pretty friendly, but the rooms are really only a scant step up from a hostel. Definitely bring your own soap and shower shoes because the floors are pretty icky in the bathroom. Elbow pads would be a plus, too, since there is little room to take a shower. The floor tended to flood after a shower and the constant leak in the sink didn't help with that, so prepare yourself if that's important to you. It wasn't to us, as we spent as little time as possible in the hotel anyway. Still, I'd recommend it if you are looking for a cheap place to stay in Amsterdam but don't want to stay in a hostel. There's no phone or tv, but it's in a great location and serves a quaint breakfast, complete with coffee/tea, ham, cheese, 3 different breads, a hard-boiled egg, jam, butter, and chocolate sprinkles (slag). I'm a vegetarian, so they were able to give me more cheese--they're pretty flexible and whichever brother is the one who does the breakfasts, he's really the nicest guy there. The one checking us in had really bloodshot eyes in the middle of the day and kept getting confused...and that's all I'll say about that. All in all, not too shabby but it could never charge that rate in a different city. I'd recommend it if you're looking for a cheap place to crash and store your stuff while you explore Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: cabandbillie
Reviews.Content: Have been stayingat Hotel Van Onna for the last 17 years of visits to Amsterdam. Loek is knowledgeable and a great host. The rooms are small but very clean. A quiet location in the Jordaan area. Nice breakfast too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Fishcalledwanda
Reviews.Content: I've spent time in a number of other Amsterdam hotels in a similar price bracket and none match up to Van Onna. Experiences with vermin and dirty sheets and towels were the norm elsewhere! Although the Van Onna is very much like staying in a hostel with an en suite shower, the place is clean and the staff are helpful. Most of all, the location is excellent. After all, how long do you want to spend in your hotel room in a city like Amsterdam?! Things you should know: 1.No shampoo or soap provided 2. Dim lightbulbs - very bad when trying to do your make-up ladies 3. No TV or radio 4. Breakfast doesn't start until 8, which is bad if you have to get to work 5. Central heating is good 6. Watch out for mosquitoes in summer 7. Reception is a little haphazard 8. Great to get anywhere from on foot or by tram 9. Fab bars, shops and restaurants in every direction 10. Interesting and friendly locals

Reviews.Title: “Basic, clean rooms in great location”
Reviews.Author: Arilisanne
Reviews.Content: As others have mentioned, don't expect anything more than the basics. I had read these reviews, and thus was prepared for anything. But I was pleasantly pleased with my experience. It's situated in a beautiful part of the Jordaan, near the Anne Frank house. The location couldn't be better, if you like being far enough away from the bustle of the city and noise to feel like you're nowhere near it, but actually being walking (or a short bus ride) distance from all the excitement. The room -- be prepared for basic and you won't be disappointed. The beds are basically army cots, but they're comfortable enough. Oh, and a "double" is really just two cots pushed together. But, there were extra blankets and pillows in the closet. The heat worked well, the room was clean, and not too small. One note, the shower had no shower curtain or door or anything - it was basically just a shower head in the wall. Good water pressure and temp, though. The only real downside of that is there's no real avoiding getting the whole bathroom wet. But, overall the staff was very nice, it was in a great location, and we didn't go to Amsterdam to spend much time in the room. Bottom line, keep your expectations basic and you'll be fine.

Reviews.Title: “I see Van Onna hasnt Changed”
Reviews.Author: Rickontheroad1
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure and also regrets about my stay in 1998 .i was lucky to have gotten there late and stayed in one of there triples for price of double .My room was towards the back and was well lit.over looking Mr.van Onna's garden i would say if the Anne Frank House and Westerkerk are your destinations its perfect ,also best Part of jordan only minutes away.in that my only regret is ,I wasnt quite ready for BASIC ,BASIC .but all in all its ok .the bathroom was small but clean .bring soap for sure ,alsothere is a great internet cafe close by on Bloemgracht. i travel to the city alot and i find if you like to be out its perfect, but i wouldnt want to get stuck in the room for a couple rainy days .i have been back in 2003 and it see is the same in 2007cant change a tradtion i guess.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic, Good location, Less than helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: trav46583
Reviews.Content: Despite calling ahead to warn the hotel that I would be arriving late in the evening (flight delays related to recent security events) nobody was there when I showed up. No answer at door, no answer on phone. I know its a budget hotel, but thats terrible. Had to get another hotel for that night - not fun. Checked into Hotel van Onna the next day. The guy offered a quiet apology. Anyway - room was very, very basic. Towels were the only amenity! It was cheaper than most other hotels in the area but you get waht you pay for. This place is closer to a hostel with private rooms than a hotel...

Reviews.Title: “very basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelingquilter
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Van Onna June 24-26 2006. Our first impression was dissapointment, although we had read the reviews and we were ready for basic we were still shocked to see just how basic it was. We had a attic room which was bright and roomy. the bath room however was extremely small and instutional like with a drain in the floor, no shower curtain,with a very small sink and toilet. shower had mold and looked like it hadn't been cleaned in a while. To dry off after the shower you have to step out of the bathroom to find a dry floor. Bring your own soap & shampoo only a very old towel is provided. The room does not have any TV or phone. The breakfast was very nice & included hard boiled egg, bread, ham, cheese, butter, chocolate sprinkles, coffee & tea. With all that said the location is fantastic! All staff was pleasant and helpful. It seemed a bit over priced at 90 euro a night.

Reviews.Title: “NOT WELCOMING AT ALL!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Van Onna for 4 nights. Although i had an early reservation they gave one the worst room of the hotel with a continuous water noise for 24 hours(apart from being dirty and dark). I asked them to change my room but they didn't, even though they had so many other rooms avaliable. In the end of my stay, when I asked a receipt for my payment, the manager acted very impolite and gave me a piece of paper which has no legal value. This hotel doesn't match with the civilized atmosfere of Amsterdam. I would suggest to look for another place.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Van Onna- good vaule, great service”
Reviews.Author: jgportguy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Van Onna from 4/16 /06 to 4/25/06. I found the hotel to be very comfortable; 2 twin beds, firm but comfortable, each w/ nite stand, very clean bath w/ shower stall ( the room was always VERY clean). No T.V., radio, phone or clock, so if this is important to you, you may want to think it over. Location was ideal, on canal, Anne Frank house and Westerkirk church at top of canal, close to trams (under 5 minute walk, top of street). Plenty of pubs and restaurants in walking distance, Dam square is about a 15 min casual walk. Simple breakfast of egg, ham and cheese slices, bread, coffee and tea included in price, all served in a pleasant breakfast room. If you chose to stay here, set your expectations accordingly. This is a European hotel, NOT American, meaning small $$ ( 45 euros per person) equals small room ( think Motel 6). The room is very basic, yet comfortable; perfect if all you want is clean accomadations for sleeping, don't plan on spending too much time in your room. The service excelled in my opinion. Every staff member was very friendly and did all they could to make our stay enjoyable. In fact, Mr. Van Onnna himself got out of bed at 4 a.m. to drive my friend to the airport when her taxi never arrived and she was going to miss her (non-refundable) flight. That speaks volumes to me about the level of service they provide, and their concern for their customers. All in all, I would definately saty at the Van Onna again, and would recommend it to all who can accept it for what it is!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the budger traveler.”
Reviews.Author: Sierrachip
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Amsterdam........My 3rd trip in 5 years....I love this city. I booked a single room for 40 euros per night. A basic room with bath & shower in room. Great location. I'll be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic”
Reviews.Author: MathiasB
Reviews.Content: This is a very basic hotel to sleep. Take your soap and shampoo with you, because just the towels were aviable in the room. This place is very quiete, and we slept well. Breakfast was also very basic. Price of 40EUR is attractive for Amsterdam, but the place is just for sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Basic lodging in great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: ZoomLady
Reviews.Content: Our four night stay in Sept. 2005 was average. The hotel is in the quiet and lovely Jordaan district, close to the Anne Frank museum and a few excellent restaurants. The staff seemed a bit rigid, but helpful if asked for information. Our room at the back was very quiet with large picture windows. The tired bathroom was generally always flooded after a shower (bring your own soap - we never got any from the maid). The beds were dorm-like, but surprisingly pretty comfortable. It was easy to use the tram (Westermarkt - take #14 from the train station) and there is a Bike City rental shop on the same block. The nearby Pancake Bakery is unique and very good (expect a wait and neutral service) and Cafe Restaurant de Reiger is excellent with a brown cafe feel to it (although they have a non-smoking section at the front).

Reviews.Title: “Quirky and charming”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a pleasant walk from the central station and on arrival we were made welcome and I can confirm the hotel is gay friendly. Our room although smaller than a room on the back, was on the canal front so worth it for the view and the lovely big sash windows which we had open the whole stay as it was quiet. Breakfast was a large continental with boiled egg, and choice of Teas or coffee, cream or milk. All served in a spacious dining area by friendly staff. The bedroom was basic but very comfortable and clean with a private shower room and toilet with fresh towels daily. The Hotel is very close to a lot of wonderful cafes/bars frequented by the locals with great menus including the famous Pancake restaurant just up from the Anne Frank Museum. From the hotel it is very easy to walk or catch the Tram to any of the shopping or museum destinations.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: biggurl2
Reviews.Content: Great location - easy to walk to various parts of the city - Anne Frank House, Rijksmuseum,Central Station, lots of shopping Great Breakfast - very filling and fairly nutritious Rooms are clean and safe but basic however very thin walls. Very friendly and helpful staff I enjoyed listening to the church bells. As I single woman traveller I whole heartedly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and quiet”
Reviews.Author: laurawd
Reviews.Content: The Van Onna isn't the most luxurious hotel around, but it's quite good value for Amsterdam. The rooms are clean, very quiet, and the owners/staff try to help where they can. I stayed there in the top room (the best), and it felt like we had a loft all to ourselves. I also stayed on the first floor - not nearly as nice, but decent for a night's sleep. I'd recommend it to budget travellers who want a quiet, quaint place to stay. Try to get the top rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Solid as Sears”
Reviews.Author: tiborjebus
Reviews.Content: First and formost - the rational for my review - I am off to Europe next month and was curious about what was being said about one of my favorite locations - Amsterdam. The van Onna is a gem = no frills, yes, but a PERFECT location and just what you need when visiting A'dam. Visit the terrific coffee shop across the street and enjoy Cafe t'Small down the street. The von Anna is wonderful -location, charm, friendlinesss; count me in for my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: mapstieks
Reviews.Content: A year after our first visit, we are returning to Van Onna. It is ideally situated, very close to Centraal Station (about 20min walk or 10min tram & walk), Anne Frank House (2min) and tram stops (4min). The mattresses are wafer thin, but that is our only complaint. Everything is super clean. Our room overlooked the canal and we sat by the window, drinking wine and enjoying Amsterdam's atmosphere after a day of sightseeing. The reviewer that complained about the shower curtain is ignorant about the fact that a lot of bathrooms in the Netherlands are of a open design. Loek do not provide soap, due to environmental concerns, but will supply if asked. The cash only policy is unusual but cannot distract from the excellent value of 40euro per person. The best thing about Van Onna is the quiet and relaxing atmosphere that prevails.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel van Onna
HotelInfo.Address: Bloemgracht 102-104 and 108, Amsterdam 1015 TN, The Netherlands
